neighbors.name: Cherry Tree Timber LLC C/O Property Tax Administration
neighbors.claims: Cherry Tree Timber LLC is a land-holding company owning multiple forested parcels in Spotsylvania County, adjacent to the proposed solar project site [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/25/virginias-biggest-proposed-solar-project-is-also-among-the-most-contentious-local-land-use-fights/). Its principals and beneficial owners are not publicly disclosed in any corporate filings or websites, indicating a private investment entity with no apparent public-facing operations (no business addresses or local offices beyond a tax mailing address) [Spotsylvania County Assessment Office](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/). The area’s timber owners have acknowledged that their “tree farm” lands will eventually be developed; for example, Riveroak Timberland (a larger timber firm in Spotsylvania) announced plans to sell its 4,575 acres to the solar developer as the "best fit" rather than keep it as timberland [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/25/virginias-biggest-proposed-solar-project-is-also-among-the-most-contentious-local-land-use-fights/). Cherry Tree Timber LLC has not taken any public stance for or against the solar project—no records of participation in hearings or local media—suggesting a neutral position focused on the property’s value and future use (likely awaiting favorable development opportunities) [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/25/virginias-biggest-proposed-solar-project-is-also-among-the-most-contentious-local-land-use-fights/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns a significant amount of land (hundreds of acres of forest); economic stake in area development, but no known local leadership or political engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the LLC’s decision-makers through its registered agent or representatives with a financial proposition (e.g., land purchase or profit-sharing). Emphasize how the development can align with their long-term ROI goals and offer assurances (like buffer zones or fire controls) to protect their remaining timber assets.

neighbors.name: GTP Acquisition Partners II LLC C/O Property Tax Dept
neighbors.claims: GTP Acquisition Partners II, LLC (doing business as “GTP”) is a telecom infrastructure holding company that is part of American Tower Corporation’s portfolio [GovTribe](https://govtribe.com/vendors/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc-g-t-p-4kl25). The company was registered in 2006 and its principal offices use American Tower’s Boston headquarters address, underscoring that it operates as a division of the national tower REIT [B2BHint](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-co/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc--20061026562). GTP Acquisition Partners II’s business is leasing antenna and tower sites; it holds the title to a cell tower parcel in Spotsylvania (PIN 44-A-11) and earns revenue from wireless carriers renting space on that tower [GovTribe](https://govtribe.com/vendors/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc-g-t-p-4kl25). The firm has no local employees or community programs and has not publicly engaged on land use issues – its interest is limited to protecting its tower asset (ensuring the solar project does not interfere with the tower’s operations) [GovTribe](https://govtribe.com/vendors/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc-g-t-p-4kl25).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns only a small tower site; minimal local presence or political involvement; influence confined to technical/permit issues for its infrastructure

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with American Tower’s site management team early to address any technical concerns (e.g., glare, access) the solar project might pose to the cell tower. Ensure them the project will not impact tower operations or maintenance access; this proactive communication should secure their neutrality, as they are generally not opposed if their asset remains unaffected.

neighbors.name: George A Sr & Kathryn B Reina Co-Tr George A Reina Sr Living Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family trust (individual landowners); no public information on community role or stance

approach_recommendations.engage: N/A (individual household; see resident engagement strategy)

overview_summary: The adjacent landowners include a private timberland investment LLC, a telecommunications infrastructure company, and a family trust. These entities appear driven by financial and land-use interests rather than community activism. The timberland owner holds extensive forest acreage and may view development as an eventual exit strategy (similar to another local timber company that endorsed selling land for the solar project) [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/25/virginias-biggest-proposed-solar-project-is-also-among-the-most-contentious-local-land-use-fights/). The telecom neighbor (part of American Tower Corp.) passively leases a cell tower site and is unlikely to engage in local development debates [GovTribe](https://govtribe.com/vendors/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc-g-t-p-4kl25). Overall, these organizational neighbors do not exhibit strong community-facing stances; their focus is on asset value and operational continuity, suggesting opportunities to address their interests through financial or technical assurances rather than political concessions.
